wikipedia_page.main: William Francis Burman (30 August 1897 – 23 October 1974) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: Horsham St Faith and Newton St Faith
response: *Sergeant William Burman (1897–1974), whose ashes were later taken to Golders Green Crematorium.
